title: Manasseh’s Sin and Repentance
summary: Manasseh is the most wicked king in Judah’s history, leading the people into deep idolatry. God allows him to be captured by Assyria. In prison, he humbles himself, repents, and is restored to the throne. He then removes idols and rebuilds worship.

faq.question: What was Manasseh known for?
faq.answer: Great wickedness, including child sacrifice and idol worship.

faq.question: What did he do after repenting?
faq.answer: He removed foreign gods and encouraged true worship again.
